snippet: Elim Chan’s victory in the Donatella Flick Conducting Competition suggests how difficult it can be to explain what quality prompts an orchestra to give its best.
abstract: Michael White Critics's Notebook column congratulates Elim Chan on her victory at Donatella Flick Conducting Competition in London; observes that excellence in conducting is so difficult to define that such competitions can seem to have questionable meaning, but asserts that each conductor had a noticeably different effect on the London Symphony Orchestra.
lead_paragraph: Elim Chan’s victory in the Donatella Flick Conducting Competition suggests how difficult it can be to explain what quality prompts an orchestra to give its best.

headline.print_headline: In a Battle of the Batons, a Barely Visible Alchemy
headline.seo: Elim Chan’s Flick Conducting Prize Is Rare Win for a Woman
headline.main: In a Battle of the Batons, a Barely Visible Alchemy
